intro: Daphnidium acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed daphnidium, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypselae. Daphnidium acuminatum is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
